title: 80/16. Open-ended working group on security of and in the use of information and communications technologies 2021–2025 established pursuant to General Assembly resolution 75/240
text:
United Nations 
A/RES/80/16 
 
General Assembly 
Distr.: General 
5 December 2025 
25-19974 (E) 
*2519974* 
 
 
Eightieth session 
Agenda item 94 
Developments in the field of information and 
telecommunications in the context of international security 
 
 
 
 
 Resolution adopted by the General Assembly 
on 1 December 2025 
 
 
[on the report of the First Committee (A/80/534, para. 7)] 
 
 
 
80/16. Open-ended working group on security of and in the use of 
information and communications technologies 2021–2025 
established pursuant to General Assembly resolution 75/240 
  
 
 
The General Assembly, 
 
Recalling its resolutions 75/240 of 31 December 2020 and 76/19 of 6 December 
2021, and noting that the open-ended working group on security of and in the use of 
information and communications technologies established pursuant to resolution 
75/240 held its organizational session and its first substantive session in 2021, its 
second and third substantive sessions in 2022, its fourth, fifth and sixth substantive 
sessions in 2023, its seventh, eighth and ninth substantive sessions in 2024, and its 
tenth and eleventh substantive sessions in 2025, 
 
Recalling also its decisions 77/512 of 7 December 2022 and 78/541 of 
22 December 2023, as well as its resolution 79/237 of 24 December 2024, 
 
Recalling further that, at its eleventh substantive session, on 11 July 2025, the 
open-ended working group considered its final report, decided to include in its report 
the outcome of the substantive discussions of the working group as contained in the 
annex to document A/80/257, and subsequently issued a compendium of statements 
in explanation of position on the adoption of the final report as document 
A/AC.292/2025/INF/5/Rev.1, 
 
1. 
Decides to endorse the final report of the open-ended working group as 
contained in document A/80/257; 
 
2. 
Requests the Secretary-General to provide the necessary support to 
operationalize all aspects of the Global Mechanism on developments in the field of 
ICTs in the context of international security and advancing responsible State 
behaviour in the use of ICTs, starting in 2026, in accordance with the elements agreed 
in annex C to document A/79/214, as endorsed by the General Assembly in its 

A/RES/80/16 
Open-ended working group on security of and in the use of 
information and communications technologies 2021–2025
established pursuant to General Assembly resolution 75/240
 
25-19974
2/2 
 
resolution 79/237, and the additional elements agreed in annex I to document 
A/80/257, in order to ensure a smooth and seamless transition from the open-ended 
working group to the Global Mechanism; 
 
3. 
Also requests the Secretary-General to provide the necessary support to 
establish the dedicated Global ICT Security Cooperation and Capacity-Building 
Portal in accordance with document A/80/257; 
 
4. 
Also decides to include in the provisional agenda of its eighty-first session 
the item entitled “Developments in the field of information and telecommunications 
in the context of international security”. 
 
52nd plenary meeting 
1 December 2025
